org.jerkar.api.depmanagement

Class JkPublisher

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jerkar.api.depmanagement.JkPublisher

  • public final class JkPublisher
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to publish artifacts on repositories. According the nature of the repository (Maven or Ivy) the publisher will also create the necessary metadata (pom.xml, metadata.xml, ivy.xml, checksums, ...).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean hasIvyPublishRepo()
      Returns true if this publisher contains Ivy reposirories.
      boolean hasMavenPublishRepo()
      Returns true if this publisher contains Maven reposirories.
      static JkPublisher of(JkPublishRepo publishRepo)
      Creates a JkPublisher with the specified JkPublishRepo.
      static JkPublisher of(JkPublishRepos publishRepos)
      Creates a JkPublisher with the specified JkPublishRepo.
      static JkPublisher of(JkPublishRepos publishRepos, java.io.File outDir)
      Creates a JkPublisher with the specified JkPublishRepo and output directory.
      void publishIvy(JkVersionedModule versionedModule, JkIvyPublication publication, JkDependencies dependencies, JkScope defaultScope, JkScopeMapping defaultMapping, java.util.Date deliveryDate, JkVersionProvider resolvedVersion)
      Publishes the specified publication to the Ivy repositories defined in this publisher
      void publishMaven(JkVersionedModule versionedModule, JkMavenPublication publication, JkDependencies dependencies)
      Publishes the specified publication on the Maven repositories of this publisher.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static JkPublisher of(JkPublishRepo publishRepo)
        Creates a JkPublisher with the specified JkPublishRepo.

      • of

        public static JkPublisher of(JkPublishRepos publishRepos,
                             java.io.File outDir)
        Creates a JkPublisher with the specified JkPublishRepo and output directory. The output directory is the place where pom.xml and ivy.xml are generated.

      • of

        public static JkPublisher of(JkPublishRepos publishRepos)
        Creates a JkPublisher with the specified JkPublishRepo. Pom.xml and ivy.xml will be generated in a temporary files then deleted.

      • publishIvy

        public void publishIvy(JkVersionedModule versionedModule,
                       JkIvyPublication publication,
                       JkDependencies dependencies,
                       JkScope defaultScope,
                       JkScopeMapping defaultMapping,
                       java.util.Date deliveryDate,
                       JkVersionProvider resolvedVersion)
        Publishes the specified publication to the Ivy repositories defined in this publisher
        Parameters:
        versionedModule - The module id and version to publish
        publication - The content of the publication
        dependencies - The dependencies of the modules (necessary to generate an ivy.xml file)
        defaultMapping -
        deliveryDate - The delivery date (necessary to generate an ivy.xml file)
        resolvedVersion - If the dependencies contains dynamic versions (as 1.0.+) then you can mention a static version replacement. If none, you can just pass JkVersionProvider.empty()

      • publishMaven

        public void publishMaven(JkVersionedModule versionedModule,
                         JkMavenPublication publication,
                         JkDependencies dependencies)
        Publishes the specified publication on the Maven repositories of this publisher.
        Parameters:
        versionedModule - The target moduleId and version for the specified publication
        publication - The content of the publication
        dependencies - The dependencies to specify in the generated pom file.

      • hasMavenPublishRepo

        public boolean hasMavenPublishRepo()
        Returns true if this publisher contains Maven reposirories.

      • hasIvyPublishRepo

        public boolean hasIvyPublishRepo()
        Returns true if this publisher contains Ivy reposirories.
